name: Bear Walk
how_to_perform:
1. Start on all fours with your hands shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Raise your hips high so that your knees are lifted slightly off the ground and your body forms an inverted ‘V’ shape. This position is similar to the downward dog in yoga.
3. Begin to "walk" by moving your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, keeping your hips raised and head aligned with your spine.
4. Follow by moving your left hand and right foot forward.
5. Continue this pattern, alternating sides, maintaining a steady pace and keeping your core engaged.
6. Focus on controlled, deliberate movements, ensuring your back stays straight and your shoulders are stable.
7. Perform the bear walk for a set distance or a specified amount of time.
short_summary: The bear walk is a full-body exercise that mimics the movement of a bear, effectively engaging multiple muscle groups including the core, shoulders, and legs.
